intro: Mesembryanthemum obliquum, commonly known as the zigzag ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. It is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appearance. Mesembryanthemum obliquum is also known for its ability to produce a gel-like substance from its leaves, which has been used in traditional medicine.
